intro: Verticordia fimbrilepis subsp. fimbrilepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved featherwing, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in heathland environments. It produces small, pinkish to reddish flowers that attract nectar-feeding insects. This subspecies is part of the family Myrtaceae and is known for its ornamental value and ecological significance.
